review_blob: Beer pours as a dark copper with a thick head. Very malty aroma. Smooth brown sugary tastes with a hopping that strikes me as odd whereby the flavor and bitter only appear on the back of the tongue. The hops tasted stale.

Pours a clean hazy pale yellow with a thin head. Sweet apple aromas that are suprisingly light. You can taste the wheat in the beer, the body is light but the flavor is big. Mostly sweet, almost like cotton candy but with a lot of fruit in the background

Had it poured on tap at the Westville Pub in Asheville. It came to the table with a thin head. The body was orangish to light copper. The aromas were citric: lemony, orange. This beer was far too hoppy for an ESB and hardly enough malt profile. Tasted like a west coast pale ale only rather watery and weak bodied as if brewed from extract. The beer was not to style and even without trying to maintain style standards this beer was not very good.

Came off the tap with a nice roasted looking head. The aroma was definitely of roasted barley. The flavor was a bit nutty with a bold roasted malt bitter mellowed by a slight sweetness in the background. A very drinkable beer.

Pours crystal clear. Wonderful aromas of citrusy hops. The flavors start with a smooth and not too harsh of a bitter and continue all the way through. No malt here, the balance definitely in favor of the hop. A very drinkable high IBU brew.

This was a very enjoyable beer. Poured with a wonderful deep dark mocha head. Frothy. The body of the beer was dark like cola but not completely opaqu. The aromas were very complex and hard to place. Definite hints of heavily roasted malts, almost like burnt walnuts. Perhaps hints of plum and definitely a hint of chocolate in the aroma and maybe some molasses. The flavor was smooth and silky with very little carbonation despite the large head. Flavor was decidedly choclaty and sweet with only hints of bitter that came more from the roast of the malt than hops.
Pretty copper/amber colored with a thick white head. Definite hints of belgian candy sugar and perhaps some biscuit malts. Full flavor masks the high abv

I found the aroma of this beer much more pleasing that most other raters. Hints of fig stood out to me. The flavor was definitely malty with only a very mild hopping that was overall bland. Not a bad beer but nothing too impressive

Pours with a thin white head. The color of the beer is an attractive mellow redish brown. Smells distinictly malty. The taste is of far too much cascade added early in the boil thus allowing the hop to dominate but not bitter the beer and also subsequently masking the malt flavors.
